content.description: This is a long, sustained ridge climb with moderate exposure. The majority of the route is easy 5th class with only a few areas of true 5.7 climbing. Its rock quality is marginal with some loose stuff especially towards the upper section.
content.protection: Nuts, small cams through #3 Camalot, lots of runners for slinging horns. A 40 meter rope worked out well. There are no anchors.
content.location: This ascends Mt. Crested Butte, looker's right of Banana Funnel and one ridge to looker's right of Guide's Ridge.

content.description: In the summer time, you can take the Silver Queen lift up and then head to the ridge from here by crossing over the talus field to the right of the lift. If you are broke like me, you hike up the mountain following the service road aiming for "The Guide's Ridge."
content.protection: This route can easily be soloed but requires a few exposed 5th class moves. If you are comfortable on easy 5th ridge climbs, this will be cruiser. This thing would eat up gear though, and there are even bolts in a few spots.
